ſide loved extremely well ſo great deſire talk private would hardly give leave ſee mother brother firſt ſalutations given general relation baſeneſs pretended weary might retire dear beliſaid believe fair ſhe carried away glory greateſt beauty gaul although cephiſe eye many yield unto young prince ariontes ſide ſo apprehenſive capable every excellency applied himſelf unto prince age equal either great madam replied ligdamon greater deſire obey thing beſeech pleaſed make ſhort relation poſſibly ſuch thing ſeem deſirous know ſhort pauſe began thus sequell hiſtory ligdamon madam ſpeaks true alwaies lyar think truth ſpeaks perfect lye unleſs lyar know lie qualification neceſſary make lyar egides none reported death becauſe thought ſo well ſelf ſay ſelf indeed full intention die heaven would permit ſhew god life abſolutely diſpoſe silvia took particular notice every word ligdamon ſpoke every one caſting eye upon able endure ſhe ſlipt amongſt companion well ſhe could got door unſeen galathea ligdamon till ſhe juſt entring chamber ſhutting door ſhe reſolved ſtay unſeen diſcourſe ended mean ligdamon continued thus since egides ſo obſervant command aſſure ſelf madam related unto replied lindam •• need nymph conſent hope obtain need ask ſo time enough yet time enough make moſt happy man upon earth think ſaid galathea ſmiled ſo eaſie matter obtain conſent madam replied lindamor beſides native barbarian baniſhed africa thouſand crime committed made ſolemn vow never pardon fortune made ſlaves pulled eye ſome cut noſes ear tongue others thus took delight torturing men sometimes inevitable death ſurrounded reſolved ſell life dear noble rate could ſeizing upon arm joyning themſelves unto vrſaces olimbres began moſt ſharp diſpute firſt began clorohalantes nothing laugh ſeeing poup done accordingly ſo ſharply thoſe defended themſelves able withſtand numeroſity enemy let ſuch free acceſſe▪ leſſe quarter hour maſters ſhip ſooner becauſe vrſaces olimbres long reſiſtance fell laſt one exceedingly weak loſs abundance blood clorohalantes proud victory ever got quite forgot price bought ſtill retained memory brave reſiſtance olimbres made ſlave fought next therefore cauſed brought ſhip commanded wound dreſſed reſolved make moſt ſolemn ſacrifice moſt glorious prey ever got ſince knew belonged unto arm sea order deſign turned ſail towards great brittain ſeeing favourable wind would need way diverſion know thoſe valour killed ſo many men therefore ſoon ʋrſaces olimbres recovered themſelves little better brought pirate addreſſing himſelf unto olimbres unto ſeemed maſter asked whence came clorohalantes ſaid olimbres unto deportment ſhewed generoſity ſpirit cavalier patrician rome name olimbres thou wilt know fortune become thy ſlave know ſave life friend follow whereof made wend courſe towards africa imbarquing ſelf ſhip thy arm hath triumphed ſubmitted unto thy ſlave thou ſeeſt know fortune bought ſince knowledge begin think fight hath made courage ſhew ſelf unto ſaid ſhe upon ſudden ſhould god promiſe cure unleſſe tircis remedy perhaps thoſe kind dieties diſpoſed ſpirit pardon ſoul receive lieu whoſe love rejected upon conſideration ſhe went gently nearer finding eye cloſed love ſaid ſhe heart faſt aſleep towards permit heaven deſires shepherd may longer contrary happineſſe ſoul may ſhare reſt body enjoyes ſaying ſo ſhe obſerved sun made ſo much entrance leaf rayes kiſſe whereat ſhe appearing little jealous ſhe kneeled thoſe kiſſes lovely tircis ſaid ſhe would better imployed thou wouldſt give unto recompence thoſe miſeries thy cruelty hath made ſuffer paſſion ſo full crime take away thee deſires enjoying good god continued ſhe ſighed loving thee perfectly merit thy hatred moſt cruel barbarous upon ſhe bended ſelf kiſſe fearing waken ſhe aroſe without ſtealing contentment yet wondering want courage ſaid ſhe ſhould much courage love ala continued ſhe could shepherd awake make himſelf thus feared arm death leaſt ſleep image death upon theſe laſt word ſhe ſtopt tircis began groan laonice ſo ſurprized ſhe got leſt ſhould perceive yet hiding ſelf behind great tree ſome twelve fifteen pace ſhe put forth head ſoftly ſhe could obſerving ſtill ſlept perhaps ſaid ſhe aſleep • ſpoke groaned compaſſion ſo ſhould ſleep give unto paſſion better teſtimonies laonice ſaid ſhe never flatter thy ſelf theſe pleaſing imagination tircis hate thee much love cleon abhor thy memory much adore thou mayeſt well believe would die love never live love thee upon ſhe would gone away caſting eye upon tircis ſhe ſaw awake ſtretching arm rubbing eye made lurk cloſe behind tree make noiſe fortune shepherd riſing ſeeing sun good hight went way thinking upon nothing elſe find cave laonice ſeeing go away ſhe felt leſſe pain heart pulling never thinking ſhe loſing ſight shepherd ſhe followed tree tree found ſought long firſt found little rivolet unto paying tribute teares preſently went ſtraight cave ſoon came entred ſoon laonice loſt ſight ſhe doubled pace without feares ſeen ſhe got near mouth ſhe could lending moſt liſtning ear hear deſignes tircis might ſhe heard ſay dear habitation may cover injury heaven thou doſt importunity laonice pardon loſt way confuſion thought abſented ſelf thee whole night lamentable dump theſe word ſtrike laonice ſhe even ready run wit ſeeing ſweet hope blaſted ſhe even ready die yet hearing tircis ſay ſomething elſe ſhe wiſhed life hear therefore heard proceed thus dear cave thou wilt make moſt happy man ever beſeech thee let live longer kill another would barbariſme kill tircis charity father genſerick embarqued himſelf flattering himſelf hope voyage would leſſe proſperous conqueſt world fond deceitful humane intention one ſingle day ſaw glory war like array vaniſh nothing leon feared anthemius ſtrong enough reſiſt ſo formidable army haſte away relief conduct one baſiliſcus favour god wind joyned defeat genſerick gave ſo ſharp chaſe conſtrained retire carthage much ſhame anthemius returned rome deſigned ſubjugate africa leave genſerick ſo much ground make himſelf grave reſolution put genſerick greater confuſion able expreſſe ſaw army defeated baſiliſcus triumphant sicily loſt vandal ruined africa affrighted ſo knowing way reſiſt enemy one day honour communicate himſelf unto freely told think himſelf able defend himſelf force way recourſe unto pollicy moſt favourable expedient would ſtop mouth enemy corrupting gift promiſes though ſpent herein rich gotten plunder rome yet would advantage gave nothing thereby preſerved life eſtate propoſition ſound well ear thinking perhaps wit enough bring imployed go unto baſiliſcus gave full power manage negotiation ſeemed good unto upon went found baſiliſcus advanced far inſiſt upon every circumſtance courſe took ſorrows preſence diana cauſed thus poor ſhepherd ſooner gotten midſt chamber legges failed upon falling finding himſelf ſwound fell upon ſide ſome two pace bed miſtreſſe diana mean ſeeing lie dead enterwoven thine would never made thee miſerable upon ſhe ſilent love ſucceeding pity ſhe looked ſaw none obſerve action ſhe kiſſed ſhe would inſpire new life lippes ſhe would waken water tear ſoever ſhepherd opened eye ſign dead though diana taken paine revive yet ſhe ſurpriſed becauſe condition wherein ſhe ſhe roſe haſt went bed never minding ſhe ſhe made haſt good ſpeed knocked head ſo hard againſt one bed poſts ſhe fell croſs body silvander crye noiſe ſhe made brought aſtrea phillis room ſeeing ſuch pityfull ſpectacle made queſtion dead love yet comming nearer ſaw silvander move arm endeavoured get body diana therefore took companion put bed lifting up▪ ſhe returned ſwound becauſe ſhe lay hand upon forhead ſhe felt pain took handkercher preſſed ſo hard place ſhe began ſwell
